And since it's ethereal it exhausts anyways

Definitely not a great card on it's own, compares very poorly to caltrops for silent. The main functions here are helping you get into defensive mode more often, and providing some thorns while you are in it. The brace is helpful, but only in particularly long boss fights, or if you can stack several protocols together to the point that you are getting 10+ brace every turn passively. The conditional thorns won't be active often enough to be very useful, and do not compare well to tourmaline. At least there are plenty of downfall bosses that attack multiple times per turn, though neow doesn't have the hearts X15. Because guardian has so many different sources of thorns, they all become less valuable, and the inconsistency of this card probably makes it one of your worst ways to get thorns.

One thing to consider with all the protocols is guardian gear. They are already pretty good in boss fights, and the effects they give are designed to balanced around them not always being active, so they can all be very powerful when combined with the free 3 (often 4, since you can work towards another turn of defensive mode through brace) turns of defensive mode, which actually makes the protocols very solid in short hallway fights too. The protocols also all play well with mummified hand so that you can offset their costs, and bird faced urn to sustain yourself over the run. Trick's Bolster Rod can also be used to help block on the turn you cast your first one, and I generally find that stacking 4-5 protocols can lead to some great defensive scaling for boss fights, though it will usually cost you in hallway fights without proper support, usually from front-loaded relics like lantern, bag of preparation, boat relics, bag of marbles, or toolbox. The upgrade is the same as caltrops (worse since it's conditional), and isn't really worth investing in unless you are already very good at entering defensive mode. I think upgrading the brace per turn would feel better as a player.
